Example:

import src/actim/vstyles

let somePadding = 20.px
let someOtherPadding = (somePadding * 2) + 3.px
let someColor = "#44ffaa"

let someStyleId = addNewVStyle:
  height {10 * somePadding}
  width {40.pct}
  padding {somePadding}, {someOtherPadding}
  fontWeight bold
  @:hover:
    backgroundColor {someColor}

let someBaseStyle = newVStyle:
  width {50.pct}

let someOtherStyleId = addExtendVStyle someBaseStyle:
  height {50.pct}

Types

Size = ref object
  case kind: SizeKind
  of calc:
      op: Op
      lhs, rhs: Size

  else:
      case isFloat: bool
      of true:
        fval: float
      of false:
        ival: int
    
  
VStyle = object
  attrs*: VAttrs
  selectors*: Table[string, VAttrs]
  node: Node

VStyleId = distinct int

func `*`(s: Size; f: float): Size {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
func `*`(s: Size; f: int): Size {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
proc `+`(a, b: Size): Size {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
proc `-`(a, b: Size): Size {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
func `/`(s: Size; f: int | float): Size
func `==`(a, b: VStyle): bool {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
func `==`(a, b: VStyleId): bool {.borrow, ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
proc addMerge[T: VStyle | VStyleId](a, b: T): VStyleId
Merge 2 vstyles and add them to the vstyle list. 
proc addVStyle(style: VStyle): VStyleId {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Add a vstyle to the list of vstyles, to be able to apply it to elements

Example:

let style = newVStyle:
  fontWeight bold

let styleId = addVStyle(style)
proc className(id: VStyleId): string {....raises: [ValueError], tags: [],
                                       forbids: [].}
Note: The vdom module uses this for rendering, you shouldn't need to call this yourself in most cases. 
func em(v: int | float): Size
proc getVStyle(id: VStyleId): VStyle {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
proc initVStyles() {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Initialise vstyles Note: This is called automatically by the setRenderer proc. 
proc merge(a, b: VStyle): VStyle {....raises: [KeyError], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Merge 2 style defenitions. If an attribute is defined in a and b, the value of b is used. 
proc merge(a, b: VStyleId): VStyle {....raises: [KeyError], tags: [], forbids: [].}
proc mgetVStyle(id: VStyleId): var VStyle {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
func pct(v: int | float): Size
func px(v: int | float): Size
proc renderStyles() {....raises: [ValueError], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Update style defenitions in the DOM. Note: The vdom module uses this for rendering, you shouldn't need to call this yourself in most cases. 
func vh(v: int | float): Size
func vmax(v: int | float): Size
func vmin(v: int | float): Size
func vw(v: int | float): Size

Macros

macro extendVStyle(extends: VStyle; body: untyped): VStyle
Extend a vstyle.

Templates

template `*`(f: int | float; s: Size): Size
template `-`(s: Size): Size
template `/`(f: int | float; s: Size): Size
template addExtendVStyle(extends: VStyle | VStyleId; body: untyped): VStyleId
Extend a vstyle and add it to the list 
template addNewVStyle(body: untyped): VStyleId
Create a vstyle and add it to the list 
template extendVStyle(extendsId: VStyleId; body: untyped): VStyle
Extend a vstyle. Note: This template is mostly usefull for styles that serve soley as base classes. If you want to use the style on elements you probably want to use addExtendVStyle 
template newVStyle(body: untyped): VStyle
Create a vstyle. Note: This template is mostly usefull for styles that serve soley as base classes. If you want to use the style on elements you probably want to use addExtendVStyle

Example:

let style = newVStyle:
  padding {5.px}, {5.px * 2}
  backgroundColor {"#44ffaa"}
  fontWeight bold
